intro: Crotalaria brasila, commonly known as the Brazilian crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features distinctive yellow flowers with a spurred shape, and its leaves are typically trifoliate. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in disturbed soils and open areas. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and research settings.
